newsitem.title: USA: Mass. Middlesex Cnty takeover expected by June 30.
newsitem.headline: Mass. Middlesex Cnty takeover expected by June 30.

text.p: An assistant attorney general for Massachusetts told a state judge on Thursday the Legislature would probably takeover fiscally challenged Middlesex county by the end of the month.

Assistant Attorney General Thomas Bean told State Superior Court Judge Hiller Zobel that he expected the House and Senate would reach agreement "on a bailout or takeover" of Middlesex county before June 30, the end of the fiscal year.
Middlesex, home to Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, defaulted on $4.5 million of notes in December. It has $2.9 million of revenue anticipation notes due on June 30.
Creditors Fleet Bank and Dreyfus Corp, represented by so many lawyers they had to sit in the jury box, agreed to wait until the end of the month.
Bean assured Zobel that there should be enough money in the county from the Deeds' excise taxes to cover salaries and ordinary offices expenses such as the "phone bill and the light bill."
